trans-unit.source: The instructions and screenshots below apply to testing a Windows Store client but, you can test this on any of the other platforms supported by Azure Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: The instructions and screenshots below apply to testing a Windows Store client but, you can test this on any of the other platforms supported by Azure Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio,run the client app and attempt to authenticate with the user account we created named Dave.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio,run the client app and attempt to authenticate with the user account we created named Dave.

trans-unit.source: Dave doesn't have membership to the Sales group.
trans-unit.target: Dave doesn't have membership to the Sales group.

trans-unit.source: So the role based access check will denied access to the table operations.
trans-unit.target: So the role based access check will denied access to the table operations.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, run the client app again.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, run the client app again.

trans-unit.source: This time authenticate with the user account we created named Bob.
trans-unit.target: This time authenticate with the user account we created named Bob.

trans-unit.source: Bob does have membership to the Sales group.
trans-unit.target: Bob does have membership to the Sales group.

trans-unit.source: So the role based access check will allow access to the table operations.
trans-unit.target: So the role based access check will allow access to the table operations.
